summary: This is an FBI 302 interview report of a victim/witness (redacted) conducted on October 15, 2019, in Miramar, Florida. The interviewee describes meeting Jeffrey Epstein around 2003 when she was approximately 16 years old, visiting his house regularly for sexual activities, and her interactions with Epstein and his associates. The document details the nature of the abuse, payment, and her initial defense of Epstein to law enforcement.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure accused of sexual abuse. The interviewee describes meeting him around age 16, visiting his house weekly for sexual activities, and him paying her for massages.

persons.name: Sarah Kellen
persons.context: Referred to as 'EPSTEIN's assistant' who called the interviewee often to schedule appointments and handle travel arrangements. The interviewee states she was nice and understood her role.

persons.name: Nadia Marcinkova
persons.context: Known to the FBI, seen often at Epstein's house. Epstein introduced her and brought her into the room during the interviewee's visits. The interviewee later learned she was referred to as his 'sex slave'.

persons.name: David Copperfield
persons.context: Mentioned as someone Epstein sent the interviewee to see for her 18th birthday.

persons.name: AUSA
persons.context: Present during the FBI interview of the victim/witness.

persons.name: Detective
persons.context: Present during the FBI interview of the victim/witness.

persons.name: FBI Victim Specialist
persons.context: Present during the interview to provide victim support.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: Conducted the interview of the victim/witness.

connections.description: Kellen is identified as Epstein's assistant who scheduled appointments and handled travel for him.
Marcinkova was often at Epstein's house and was introduced by him to the interviewee. The interviewee later learned Marcinkova was referred to as his 'sex slave'.
The interviewee, starting around age 16, visited Epstein's house weekly for sexual activities which he directed and paid her for.
Kellen contacted the interviewee often to schedule appointments with Epstein and handle travel details.

events.title: First Meeting with Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: The interviewee, approximately 16 years old, first met Jeffrey Epstein through a friend. She was offered $200 to give him a back massage at his house.

events.title: Regular Visits to Epstein's House
events.description: Between ages 16-18, the interviewee visited Epstein's house about once a week (less than 50 times total) for sexual activities which he directed.

events.title: Cessation of Contact
events.description: The interviewee stopped seeing Epstein around the summer of 2005. After she turned 18, Epstein and his associates stopped calling her.

events.title: FBI Interview
events.description: The interviewee was interviewed by the FBI, with an AUSA and a detective present, in Miramar, Florida.

events.title: Epstein Investigation Begins
events.description: Mention of Epstein's investigation beginning around 2006, prompting the interviewee's parents to talk to Palm Beach Police.

locations: Epstein's house (location unspecified in this excerpt)
keyFacts: The interviewee was approximately 16 years old in 2003 when she first met Jeffrey Epstein and began visiting his house weekly for sexual activities.
Epstein's assistant, Sarah Kellen, regularly contacted the interviewee to schedule appointments and handle travel, including a trip to Cancun, Mexico.
The interviewee states that Nadia Marcinkova was often at Epstein's house and was introduced to her; she later learned Marcinkova was referred to as Epstein's 'sex slave'.
The interviewee initially defended Epstein to the FBI because she did not understand what was happening at the time.
Payments of $200 were made for massages, either by Epstein in the room or by Kellen in the kitchen.
